page.title: 17Changing Times-School Life
page.content: {Christchurch school,}rebuilt in 1848 continues to be used by{Alsager {Comprehensive School.}In 1918 the three classrooms with wooden floors, high circled windows and fireplaces contained two classes each of 45 pupils. It was cold and drafty. The school day began with assembly followed by scripture. Children sat on long benches, in rows facing the teacher. Drill was done in the road. Boys and girls had separate playgrounds and went home for dinner. {Cranberry County Junior School}built in 1975 is of open-plan design. Floors are carpeted, walls display children's work. Classes of 30-35 pupils sit in groups around tables in the teaching area. Homebays, attractively curtained are used for registration. Children dine in the craft areas. The building is centrally heated.
